description: This app has an addiction of crashing.
Please workaround to resolve.

There should not be this many bad reviews. This app has, and will continue to be, a staple for my Linux desktop environment that I use for developing software & web application. I don't ever have to troubleshoot "Fonts", I don't have to do anything extra to get it working. I can install from the command line, or from the software app included with any distro. Its a simple app, with a simple job, and it does it well. This is a robust piece of software. I can verify that it works on both RHEL (Fedora 35/36 Workstation) & Debian (Ubuntu 18.04-22.04.
summary: Works Great! I use it on Fedora 36: Workstation & Ubuntu 22.04

description: i really love the app
When I launch it I get "Failed to start /usr/share/applications/org.gnome.font-viewer.desktop'". Please fix this!

When I first tried it, it didn't open. Then I changed my path command for another script and when I came back to it, it worked,
I modified the PATH by adding this line to the /home/YOURuserNAME/.bashrc file
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:.
summary: Works well after changing my PATH

description: Why is it so hard to just put nothing here? Make your app work!
